title.narrative: Emergency Response to Large Scale Attacks in Ukraine (contribution to EA)

description.narrative:
Contribution to CI Appeal: EA03/2022 Ukraine Partners: Caritas Ukraine and Caritas SPES
24 Feb 2022, Russia announced invasion of Ukraine. Military invasion will have dire consequences for Ukraine; threatening civilian lives, livelihood and infrastructure; and has already caused food shortages and early displacement. Already people evacuating and in need of information and assistance; transportation; food, water; items to protect from harsh winter environment; medical support' assistance with legal documents; psychosocial support and assistance to children. Children in Ukrainian residential institutions, particularly those close to front line are at risk or harm and trauma. Ukraine has one of largest caseloads of children in institutions in the world.
- Caritas Ukraine working with 19 of its centers across country for initial response. Each center will implement location-specific plan based on what is feasible considering team size and capacity, coordination with public authorities and other orgs, and assessments of logistical possibilities. Following services most needed: receiving and registering families; transportation; operation of centers; light case management. - Caritas SPES (NGO of the Religious Mission of the Roman Catholic Church in Ukraine) in contact with 22 of their small group homes to plan for safe evacuations of children, and children in state led institutions, to Caritas SPES' fully-equipped camp facilities in Western Ukraine. They will continue to offer psycho-social support and therapy.
Total number of planned beneficiaries: 5000 HH (2.8 average members per HH)
